key_facts: The Environment Agency is urging farmers to comply with water abstraction rules.
Farmers must have a licence to take over 20 cubic metres of water per day.
Farmers must monitor water use with a meter.
Inspections in Devon and Cornwall found widespread unlicensed water use.
The Environment Agency took 70 enforcement actions over two years.
Climate change and population growth may reduce water availability by 15% by 2050.
Breaching water licence conditions can harm the environment.
Violating water rules can lead to legal consequences.
Compliance helps protect water resources for other users and ecosystems.
